critical_failure.title: Replacement Required
critical_failure.summary: Based on your answers, repair is not a safe or effective option for your windshield damage.
critical_failure.explanation: The damage characteristics you've described mean that repair would not be effective or safe. Your situation meets one or more criteria that make replacement necessary: Why Replacement is Required: • Location issues: Damage in the driver's view, ADAS camera zone, or at the edge compromises critical safety functions • Size limits exceeded: Cracks longer than 6 inches or multiple damage points cannot be reliably repaired • Structural penetration: Damage through both layers of laminated glass has compromised the windshield's structural integrity Replacement Requirements: • Use OEM glass for ADAS vehicles: Aftermarket glass can have optical distortions that prevent proper camera calibration • ADAS calibration is mandatory: Not optional—required for safety systems to function correctly • Choose AGSC-certified installer: Ensures proper techniques and materials • Respect Safe Drive-Away Time: Adhesive must cure completely (typically 1+ hours) • Get written warranty and calibration documentation: Proof that work was done correctly

excellent.title: Excellent Repair Candidate
excellent.summary: Your windshield damage meets all the criteria for professional repair.
excellent.explanation: Great news! Your damage meets all the criteria for a successful professional repair. This is significantly better than replacement for several reasons: Benefits of Repair: • Cost savings: $50-100 vs $500-1,000+ for replacement • Preserves factory seal: Keeps your original OEM glass and its perfect fit • Quick service: 30-60 minutes vs 2+ hours for replacement • Often $0 insurance deductible: Most insurers waive deductible for repairs • No ADAS calibration needed: Saves $150-300 and avoids calibration risks • Environmental benefit: Prevents 60+ lbs of glass from landfills ⚠️ Critical DIY Warning: Do NOT attempt DIY repair kits. They use inferior materials, create permanent contamination if they fail, and make professional repair impossible—forcing expensive replacement. You only get one chance to repair damage correctly. Act Quickly: Temperature changes and road vibrations cause chips to spread. What's repairable today may require replacement tomorrow.

likely.title: Repair Likely Possible
likely.summary: Your damage appears repairable, but some factors may affect success.
likely.explanation: Your windshield damage appears to be within repairable limits, but the age, contamination, or spreading may affect the repair's success rate. Professional inspection is needed to make a final determination. Why Act Quickly: • Age matters: Older damage has more contamination and is harder to clean • Spreading risk: Any crack that has grown is under stress and will continue to spread • Contamination concerns: Dirt and moisture reduce repair bond strength Benefits of Successful Repair: • Cost: $50-100 vs $500-1,000+ for replacement • Preserves factory OEM glass and seal • Quick: 30-60 minutes • Often $0 insurance deductible • No ADAS calibration needed ⚠️ DIY Warning: Never use DIY repair kits. Failed DIY repairs contaminate the damage permanently and force expensive replacement. Professional technicians have the tools to clean and properly bond the repair. Be Prepared: Get evaluated quickly, but understand that the technician may recommend replacement if contamination is too severe or the damage has spread beyond repairable limits.
nextSteps: Check insurance coverage for both repair and replacement

borderline.title: Borderline Case - Evaluation Needed
borderline.summary: Your damage is near the limits of repairability. Professional evaluation needed urgently.
borderline.explanation: Your windshield damage is at or near the limits of what can be safely and effectively repaired. A professional technician needs to evaluate it in person to determine if repair is possible. Borderline Factors: • Size or location: Approaching the edge of repairable zones • Age and contamination: May have too much dirt or moisture intrusion • Spreading: Active crack growth indicates structural stress • Old damage: Contamination and bonding challenges increase over time Get Evaluated Immediately: Time is critical. Every hour of delay allows more contamination, moisture intrusion, and spreading. What might be barely repairable today could require replacement tomorrow. If Repair is Possible: • Cost: $50-100 vs $500-1,000+ • Preserves factory seal • No ADAS calibration needed • Often $0 insurance deductible If Replacement is Needed: Replacement restores full structural integrity and ADAS function. Ensure you use OEM glass and get proper ADAS calibration. ⚠️ DIY Warning: Do NOT try DIY repair. Borderline damage requires professional equipment and expertise. DIY failure will force expensive replacement.
nextSteps: If replaced: verify OEM glass and ADAS calibration included

replacement.title: Replacement Recommended
replacement.summary: Based on your answers, replacement is the recommended option.
replacement.explanation: The damage you've described is beyond the limits of safe and effective repair. While this may not be a critical safety failure, the characteristics suggest that repair would likely fail or provide inadequate structural restoration. Why Replacement is Recommended: • Very old damage (6+ months): Severe contamination makes bonding unreliable • Heavy contamination or failed DIY attempt: Permanent damage to repair potential • Active spreading: Indicates ongoing structural failure • Low total score: Multiple marginal factors that collectively exceed repair limits Replacement Requirements: • Use OEM glass for ADAS vehicles: Ensures proper camera calibration and safety system function • ADAS calibration is mandatory: Not optional—required by vehicle manufacturers • AGSC-certified installer: Proper training in modern windshield safety standards • Respect Safe Drive-Away Time: Adhesive cure time (typically 1+ hours) is critical for safety • Written warranty and calibration documentation: Proof of proper installation Cost Considerations: Replacement costs $500-1,000+, but insurance may cover it with just your comprehensive deductible (often $100-500). Check if you're in a zero-deductible state (FL, KY, SC) or have full glass coverage.
